  • Code and Cipher Center 1.0 documentation »

Cipher¶

Interfaces with the Cipher model.

cccenter.python.cipher.affine_cipher(text, a, b)¶

Applies the Affine Cipher on a piece of text.

Parameters:
  • text (str) – The text to be encrypted
  • a (int) – The Affine Cipher multiplier key
  • b (int) – The Affine Cipher additive key
Returns:

The encrypted text, all upper case
Return type:

str

Warning

The affine cipher computes Cipher = (a*position + b) mod 26 and is invalid for even values of a and when a is congruent to 13 mod 26

cccenter.python.cipher.caesar_shift_encode(text, shift)¶

Applies the Caesar Shift Cipher to the given ciphertext.

Parameters:
  • text (str) – The text to be encrypted
  • shift (int) – The Caesar Shift key
Returns:

The encrypted text, all upper case
Return type:

str
cccenter.python.cipher.check_solution(challenge_id, user_id, guessed_plaintext)¶

Checks if the suggested solution is correct.

Parameters:
  • challenge_id (int) – The associated challenge’s id
  • user_id (int) – The current user’s id
  • guessed_plaintext (str) – The proposed solution to the challenge
Returns:

True if the proposed solution is correct, false if it is not
Return type:

boolean

Warning

If the challenge_id or user_id is not valid, will throw an error.

Warning

Does not check if the user is registered in the challenge before checking that the solution is correct.

cccenter.python.cipher.create_ciphertext(ciphertype, plaintext)¶

Returns a ciphertext and key using the given ciphertype.

Parameters:
  • ciphertype (str) – The cipher to apply to the text
  • plaintext (str) – The text to encrypt
Returns:

‘ciphertext’ (str): The encrypted ciphertext (string)
Returns:

‘cipherkey’ (str): The cipher key (string)
Return type:

dict

Warning

Although ciphertype is a string, it must match one of the Cipher objects in the database or it will throw an error.

Note

The cipherkey is stored for display purposes only, so it is always stored as a string.

cccenter.python.cipher.multiplicitive_cipher(text, mult)¶

Applies the Multiplicitive Shift Cipher to a piece of text.

Parameters:
  • text (str) – The text to be encrypted
  • mult (int) – The Multiplicitive Cipher multiplier key
Returns:

The encrypted text, all upper case
Return type:

str

Warning

Cipher = (mult * position) mod 26 and is invalid for even multiples
